images.copyright: Roland's Breach, Ordesa y Monte Perdido National Park, Spain (© Inaki Relanzon/Nature Picture Library/Alamy Stock Photo)
images.title: Once more unto the breach
images.caption: Roland's Breach, Spain
images.copyrightonly: © Inaki Relanzon/Nature Picture Library/Alamy Stock Photo
images.desc: High up in the Pyrenees, there is a gap in the mountains. More than 90 metres tall and 39 metres wide, Roland's Breach, featured here today, is a sight to behold. But who was Roland? Count Roland was a Frankish military leader during Charlemagne's reign in the 8th century. Legend has it that, after being defeated in battle, Roland cut a gap in the mountains—either to destroy his sword or to catch one last glimpse of France.

og.title: Roland's Breach, Spain
og.desc: High up in the Pyrenees, there is a gap in the mountains. More than 90 metres tall and 39 metres wide, Roland's Breach, featured here today…

images.copyright: Dragon dance, Wuhan, China (© Miao Jian/Wuhan Morning Post/Visual China Group via Getty Images)
images.title: Happy Chinese New Year!
images.caption: Chinese New Year
images.copyrightonly: © Miao Jian/Wuhan Morning Post/Visual China Group via Getty Images
images.desc: The streets come alive today with a symphony of firecrackers, red lanterns and cheerful chatter—it's Chinese New Year. Steeped in thousands of years of tradition, this holiday marks the start of the lunisolar Chinese calendar. One of the most captivating images associated with this festival is the dragon dance, pictured here. This is a mesmerising performance where skilled dancers manipulate a long, flexible dragon puppet, bringing it to life with sinuous, undulating movements. The dragon, a symbol of power, dignity and good fortune, is believed to bring luck to the community, with longer dragons bringing even more prosperity.

og.title: Chinese New Year
og.desc: The streets come alive today with a symphony of firecrackers, red lanterns and cheerful chatter—it's Chinese New Year. Steeped in thousands…

images.copyright: Short-eared owl hunting in heavy snow (© Dilshan Muthalib/Getty Images)
images.title: Snow-way you'll miss it
images.caption: Short-eared owl
images.desc: The short-eared owl, featured in today's image, is a grassland-dwelling member of the owl family. Found on all continents except Antarctica and Australia, it's one of the most widely distributed bird species. In India, it can be spotted in the open grasslands and vast stretches of the Little Rann of Kutch, as well as the surrounding desert landscape. This raptor belongs to the genus Asio, whose members are characterised by feather tufts ('ears') on their heads. The short-eared owl only reveals its tufts when feeling defensive.

og.title: Short-eared owl
og.desc: The short-eared owl, featured in today's image, is a grassland-dwelling member of the owl family. Found on all continents except Antarctica…

images.copyright: Zoroaster Temple, Grand Canyon National Park, Arizona, USA (© Nick Lake/Tandem Stills + Motion)
images.title: Peaked your curiosity
images.caption: Zoroaster Temple, Grand Canyon National Park, Arizona, United States
images.desc: Carved by the Colorado River, nearly 2 billion years of Earth's history are exposed in the layers of the Grand Canyon. While geologists continue to debate parts of the formation story of the canyon, recent studies suggest the river carved its path through the region about 5 to 6 million years ago. Since then, the river has been deepening and widening the canyon while sculpting its dramatic geographical features.

og.title: Zoroaster Temple, Grand Canyon National Park, Arizona, United States
og.desc: Carved by the Colorado River, nearly 2 billion years of Earth's history are exposed in the layers of the Grand Canyon. While geologists…

images.copyright: India Gate, New Delhi (© Amith Nag Photography/Getty Images)
images.title: Three shades, one spirit
images.caption: Republic Day
images.desc: Republic Day isn't just any other occasion—it's an emotion. Every year on this day, the country wakes up to patriotic anthems, flag hoistings and a sense of unity. In 1950, on this day, India adopted its Constitution, officially becoming a sovereign republic. The President of India delivers an address to the nation on the eve of Republic Day. On the day itself, he raises the national flag in New Delhi, while Governors and Lieutenant Governors perform flag-hoisting ceremonies in their respective states and union territories.

og.title: Republic Day
og.desc: Republic Day isn't just any other occasion—it's an emotion. Every year on this day, the country wakes up to patriotic anthems, flag…

images.title: Golden hour in Porto
images.caption: Porto, Portugal
images.desc: Today's image takes us to a city that is bold, unpolished in the best way, and brimming with personality. While it's famous for its port wine (cheers to that!), there's so much more to discover in the Portuguese city of Porto. As you walk through its streets, you'll notice façades adorned with azulejos—painted tin-glazed ceramic tilework found in Portugal and Spain—historic churches like São Francisco, and the iconic Dom Luís I Bridge, which spans the Douro River, which runs through the city.

og.title: Porto, Portugal
og.desc: Today's image takes us to a city that is bold, unpolished in the best way, and brimming with personality. While it's famous for its port…

images.copyright: Strokkur geyser in Iceland (© John and Tina Reid/Getty Images)
images.title: Bubbling with power
images.caption: Strokkur geyser in Iceland
images.desc: Strokkur geyser—featured in today's image—warms up winter in a completely different way. It is a fountain geyser known for its frequent and reliable eruptions. Located in the geothermal area beside the Hvítá River in Iceland, this geyser erupts every 6 to 10 minutes, shooting hot water 14 to 20 metres into the air, sometimes erupting up to 40 metres.

og.title: Strokkur geyser in Iceland

images.copyright: Deer Valley at dusk, Park City, Utah, USA (© Adventure_Photo/Getty Images)
images.title: Movies, mountains and magic
images.caption: Sundance Film Festival
images.desc: Today, the Sundance Film Festival kicks off, celebrating the magic of movies against the backdrop of Utah's mountains in the United States. As a launchpad for groundbreaking films and emerging talent, Sundance has come a long way since its humble beginnings in 1978. Now one of the film industry's most influential events, it has introduced the world to talents like Quentin Tarantino and Steven Soderbergh, whose early works premiered here before shaping their iconic careers. With competitive sections for dramatic and documentary movies, from features to shorts, the festival offers an inspiring array of storytelling.

og.title: Sundance Film Festival
og.desc: Today, the Sundance Film Festival kicks off, celebrating the magic of movies against the backdrop of Utah's mountains in the United States…
